channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: US justice department charges Hamas leaders over deadly October 7 attack on Israel
item.description: The US justice department has charged Yahya Sinwar and other key Hamas figures for their roles in the October 7, 2023 attack on Israel. Accusations include conspiracy to support terrorism and murder of US citizens. Despite challenges in apprehending them, this action aims to hold Hamas accountable for decades of alleged attacks.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 5 children arrested for murder after 80-year-old British-Indian dog walker attacked in park
item.dc:creator: Naomi Canton

item.title: What's so special about Kamala Harris' tan suit that Obama's didn't have
item.description: Kamala Harris donned a tan suit at the Democratic National Convention, mirroring Barack Obama's controversial fashion choice from ten years ago. While Obama's suit faced criticism, Harris's decision is interpreted as a confident statement. Obama too took note how his tan suit got a makeover and made a reappearance through Harris.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump says he'd release Jeffrey Epstein files: 'Fortunately, I was not...'
item.description: "He (Epstein) was a good salesman. He was a hale and hearty type of a guy. He had some nice assets that he'd throw around like islands. But a lot of big people went to that island. But fortunately I was not one of them," Trump said adding that Kennedy files are very different from Epstein files but he would be inclined to release the latter as well as he has no problem.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nepal plans to issue new banknotes featuring disputed territories with India within a year: Report
item.description: Nepal's central bank is proceeding with plans to print new banknotes featuring a revised map that includes disputed territories with India, such as Kalapani, Lipulekh, and Limpiyadhura. This initiative follows a cabinet decision led by former Prime Minister Pushpa Kamal Dahal 'Prachanda' and aims for completion within six months to one year.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kash Patel predicts major power grid attack in US before election: 'Something's gonna happen'
item.description: Kash Patel, an ex-Trump administration official, has forecasted a major power grid attack in the US coinciding with the election cycle. Speaking on a podcast, he said the intel community right now is playing catch up on half these attacks because it wasn't a priority to preemptively detect them and thwart the attack.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Former aide to New York's guv, husband arrested: 'Undisclosed agent of China govt'
item.description: Linda Sun, former deputy chief of staff to New York Governor Kathy Hochul, faces charges for acting as an undisclosed agent for the Chinese government. Along with her husband Chris Hu, she was arrested at their Long Island home. They are accused of blocking Taiwanese officials and laundering money from China to buy a $4.1 million property.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk says friends of his mother assaulted thrice this year in New York
item.description: Elon Musk, who supports Donald Trump for the November election, criticized migrant-related crimes in NYC, sharing a report that claims 75% of recent arrests in Midtown involve migrants. Musk said friends of his mother were assaulted thrice this year in New York with the offenders getting no punishment at all.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: No concrete step on Turkey Brics membership, Erdogan's party says
item.description: Turkey has shown interest in joining the Brics group of emerging economies but has not yet taken concrete steps. The group includes Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa, Ethiopia, Iran, Egypt and the UAE. This development raises concerns among Western allies about Turkey's geopolitical orientation and commitment to Nato responsibilities.

item.title: Tech magnate goes full MAGA: Elon Musk backs Trump all the way
item.description: Elon Musk has declared his support for Donald Trump, calling the Democratic Party criminals and posting an AI-generated image of Kamala Harris in a communist outfit without clarification. He expressed interest in joining a potential Trump administration to cut wasteful government programs. Musk's stance on free speech has led to significant criticism and controversy.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: 'This aint Colorado': Venezuelan gang now taking over Chicago apartment?
item.description: An audio clip of a 911 call has gone viral, alleging that a Venezuelan gang took over an apartment complex in Chicago. Despite police intervention, no suspects were apprehended. This follows a similar incident in Colorado, which authorities have dismissed as exaggerated. Social media reactions have been intense, with calls for stronger action.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: JD Vance has done 94 interviews since VP nomination as his strategy is...
item.description: An Axios report said Vance has done 94 interviews, press conferences and gaggles with the media and has actively courted adversarial outlets that Republicans often avoid. According to a campaign count, Vance has give nearly as many as interviews to traditional media outlets as he has to conservative media. Vance did all five major Sunday shows in the past month, including three of them in one day.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Netanyahu refuses to budge on war despite protests over hostages
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu continues his hard-line approach on Hamas despite protests over the killing of six hostages. The US calls for a cease-fire, and the UK suspends some arms licenses. Protesters demand more concessions in truce talks to secure the release of remaining abductees and pause the long-standing conflict.

item.title: At least 13 dead as boat carrying over 50 migrants sinks in English Channel
item.description: A boat carrying more than 50 migrants sank off France's northern coast in the English Channel, resulting in at least 13 fatalities and several critical injuries. The incident near Gris-Nez point led to a significant rescue operation. This event highlights the ongoing risks faced by migrants attempting dangerous crossings to reach the UK.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Mongolia ignores an international warrant for Putin's arrest, giving him a red-carpet welcome
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin visited Mongolia and received a red-carpet welcome despite calls for his arrest on an international warrant for alleged war crimes in Ukraine. The visit underscores Mongolia's economic dependence on Russia and China, complicating its position as an ICC member obligated to detain suspects. Agreements were signed to enhance bilateral cooperation.

item.title: Against banning Awami League, its arch-rival parties say
item.description: The BNP and Jamaat oppose banning the Awami League, despite being targeted by them previously. They prefer electoral defeat over bans. The interim government led by Muhammad Yunus is preparing for new elections after Sheikh Hasina resigned and fled to India amid prolonged protests over government job quotas.

item.title: Piers Morgan wonders whether Biden spoke to George Clooney after his 'hit job'
item.description: George Clooney now praising his old friend Biden and comparing him with George Washington will not salvage the damage that Clooney's NYT op-ed did, Piers Morgan said. Biden did not make a selfless sacrifice but was bullied, shamed and humiliated into doing it by his so-called friends like Clooney, Morgan wrote.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why Brittany Mahomes supporting Donald Trump is awkward for Taylor Swift
item.description: What makes this situation particularly awkward is Brittany Mahomes's rumoured friendship with Taylor Swift, whose political beliefs are well known. Swift broke her long-held silence on politics in 2018, endorsing Democratic candidates and speaking out on issues such as women’s rights, LGBTQ+ rights, and racial equality. This marked a significant departure from her previously neutral public persona and positioned her as a prominent voice against Trump’s policies. Her activism continued into the 2020 presidential election when she endorsed Joe Biden and Kamala Harris.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Democrat Guv has a warning for Kamala Harris on debate with Trump: 'He won against Hilary, Biden'
item.description: “We shouldn’t be thinking that somehow Kamala Harris has a greater ability to win a debate than Donald Trump,” Pritzker continued. “They’re going to come in as significant rivals with very, very different points of view.” Donald Trump and Kamala Harris will face each other on September 10 in their first debate to be hosted by ABC News
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: What is ‘Founder Mode’? Is it inspired by Steve Jobs?
item.description: Paul Graham introduces 'Founder Mode,' advocating for startup founders to remain deeply involved in their companies rather than adopting traditional managerial roles. This approach promotes swift decision-making, preserves company culture, and fosters innovation but may face challenges as the company scales. It emphasizes direct communication and trust within the team.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
